養.definition: to raise (animals); to bring up (children); to keep (pets); to support; to give birth

養傷.definition: to heal a wound; to recuperate (from an injury)

養兒防老.definition: (of parents) to bring up children for the purpose of being looked after in old age

養兵千日，用兵一時.pinyin: yang3 bing1 qian1 ri4 , yong4 bing1 yi1 shi2
養兵千日，用兵一時.definition: lit. Train an army for a thousand days to use it for an hour. (idiom); fig. extensive preparation eventually pays off

養兵千日，用在一時.pinyin: yang3 bing1 qian1 ri4 , yong4 zai4 yi1 shi2
養兵千日，用在一時.definition: see 養兵千日，用兵一時|养兵千日，用兵一时[yang3 bing1 qian1 ri4 , yong4 bing1 yi1 shi2]

養兵千日，用在一朝.pinyin: yang3 bing1 qian1 ri4 , yong4 zai4 yi1 zhao1
養兵千日，用在一朝.definition: lit. train an army for a thousand days to use it for one morning (idiom); fig. extensive preparation eventually pays off

養地.definition: to maintain the land (with rotation of crops or fertilizer)

養家.definition: to support a family; to raise a family

養廉.definition: to encourage honesty; to discourage corruption

養成.definition: to cultivate; to raise; to form (a habit); to acquire

養樂多.definition: Yakult (Japanese brand of fermented milk drink)

養活.definition: to provide for; to keep (animals, a family etc); to raise animals; to feed and clothe; support; the necessities of life; to give birth

養生.definition: to maintain good health; to raise a child or animal; curing (of concrete etc)

養生之道.definition: the way of maintaining good health

養生送死.definition: to be looked after in life and given a proper burial thereafter (idiom)

養病.definition: to recuperate; to convalesce; to take care of one's health after illness

養癰貽患.definition: lit. to foster an ulcer and bequeath a calamity (idiom); tolerating budding evil can only lead to disaster; to cherish a viper in one's bosom

養癰遺患.definition: lit. to foster an ulcer and bequeath a calamity (idiom); tolerating budding evil can only lead to disaster; to cherish a viper in one's bosom

養眼.definition: visually attractive; eye candy; easy on the eyes; to protect the eyes

養神.definition: to rest; to recuperate; to regain composure

養精蓄銳.definition: to preserve and nurture one's spirit (idiom); honing one's strength for the big push

養老.definition: to provide for the elderly (family members); to enjoy a life in retirement

養老送終.definition: to look after one's aged parents and arrange proper burial after they die

養老金雙軌制.pinyin: yang3 lao3 jin1 shuang1 gui3 zhi4

養育.definition: to rear; to bring up; to nurture

養虎傷身.definition: Rear a tiger and court disaster. (idiom); fig. if you're too lenient with sb, he will damage you later; to cherish a snake in one's bosom

養虎為患.definition: lit. to nurture a tiger invites calamity; fig. to indulge one's enemy is asking for trouble (idiom)

養虎遺患.definition: Rear a tiger and court disaster. (idiom); fig. if you're too lenient with sb, he will damage you later; to cherish a snake in one's bosom

養護.definition: to maintain; to conserve; curing (concrete etc)

養顏.definition: to nourish one's skin; to maintain a youthful appearance
